Review Title: The Slow Death of a Giant
Pros:
-The compensation when first starting is great. Possibly slightly lower pay than other companies, but great benefits.
-Great work life/home life balance depending on team.
-Incredibly smart and talented people to learn from and work with.
-Dependent on team, but many managers lead with empathy and understanding. You are treated like an adult and expected to be able to self motivate.
Cons:
-Compensation goes downhill the longer you stay.
-Making any headway on new projects is near impossible. A lot of meetings with zero progress made, and unless you're working on something flashy, you'll be given zero resources and encounter active roadblocks to progress and change.
-Lack of ownership and accountability. If internal systems exist for specific vertical information, it's outdated. More often than not, it doesn't exist.
-Appearance is more important than actual performance. Office politics are intense and it's not what you know, it's who you know.
-ELT lacks transparency and clear communication. The strategy is always working, even when it's not. 
-Regular layoffs that are not performance based. The only warning you may receive will be a company wide email at the end of business the day before anyone knows if they're impacted or not.
-The company has lost sight of what made it great.

Review Title: A step in the wrong direction
Pros: Since eBay's acquisition of my employer, TCGplayer, a lot has changed, but there are still things about my job that I enjoy. I have many years of experience specializing in many different parts of the work we do, and enjoy the ability to do work I excel at, that adds a lot of value. Additionally, I have a lot of great coworkers that make the work environment fun and enjoyable to spend 40 hours a week at.
Cons: Regrettably, eBay has made a mess of their acquisition of TCGplayer in many ways. For a large company with a long history of purchasing other companies, the transition from to eBay's systems, pay structure, and benefits were very poor, despite having a dedicated transition team meant to facilitate these processes. Additionally, eBay was eager to continue TCGplayer's stance of poor cooperation with their democratically elected union, from running a highly aggressive anti-union campaign during the union election process, to delaying the bargaining processes with baseless legal appeals. Beyond this, our pay has been stagnant for the last 3 years, does not account for the cost of living or rising inflation. Additionally, we have seen a reduction in available paid time off since the eBay acquisition.
